meanings.definition: A psychological or emotional difficulty or inhibition.
meanings.sent1: Her hangup about public speaking made her nervous.
meanings.sent2: His hangup about heights prevented him from going on the roller coaster.
meanings.sent3: She had a hangup about wearing mismatched socks.
meanings.sent4: His hangup about germs was like a shield against any physical contact.
meanings.sent5: The hangup she had about spiders was so intense that she couldn't even look at a picture of one.

meanings.sent1: The traffic jam was a hangup on their way to the airport.
meanings.sent2: The technical hangup caused the presentation to start late.
meanings.sent3: The hangup with the printer made it impossible to finish the report on time.
meanings.sent4: The hangup in the supply chain slowed down production significantly.
meanings.sent5: The hangup in the system caused frustration among the users.

meanings.sent1: His hangup with cleanliness made him constantly tidy up.
meanings.sent2: Her hangup with fashion led her to spend hours shopping for the perfect outfit.
meanings.sent3: His hangup with punctuality made him always arrive early to appointments.
meanings.sent4: Her hangup with organization made her label everything in her room.
meanings.sent5: His hangup with perfectionism made him redo his work multiple times.
